reviews.review_msg: Oops, previous rant should be about 221.  Took 280 by distance ed. He seemed scary on webct, but the live version is seriously high value. If you are not very bright or really lazy he might be too challenging. In tutorials he puts you on the spot, which cuts down on idiots babbling to get attendance points.Love it. Gourmet education. Four stars.

I liked how he sometimes yelled during the class because 8:30 lecture in the morning can be very dreadful if the professor is monotoned. Tyler however has amazing ability to keep students alert during the class and does not just teach stuff from textbook. Make sure you study his study questions he assigns at the end of the class. Fair exams.

She was pretty funny, kept lectures pretty interesting.  She never lectured for the full 3 hours.  Assignments were a little brutal but the tests were pretty straight forward.  Not difficult to get a good mark with her.

BERT IS AMAZING!! He loves to crack jokes and is super corky which is great for an early morning class. His slides are literally a condensed version of the textbook. Otherwise, I honestly wouldn't go to most classes if it wasn't for him himself - along with the participation assignments.
Very nice guy however worst class i've taken because it ruined by gpa. In class quizzes every week all long answer, none have I passed yet. These count for 25% of your mark.

absolutely terrible. he is good person but not good teacher. he's so lazy he uses lecture slides from last year they are not even updated. his lectures  do not make any sense and they are not helpful; this is the first psychology class that I had ever trouble with. avoid at all cost you learn nothing in his class.

Gosh his lectures are so boring. He is somewhat like Dr. Day assigning tons of readings and quizzes, but way harder. I was surprised how he assigned three chapters to read in one week and have a quiz right away. He grades you relative to other students so just hope your classmates are not so smart. Just read the textbook and you should be fine.

So hard to stay focused during lectures, he is sooooo monotone :( I wish his guest speakers did all the lectures, they made their topics interesting... Attendance is mandatory as there is a quiz almost every class. And you seriously need to read the textbook to do well on midterms/finals.

oh god yes.. i just read the most recent review. i came back to see if this prof had improved at all but I am not surprised,.. one of the most odious classes Ive experienced. One wants to pull out their hair rather than listen to this man lecture.*yawn*

Do not take a class with this prof! Class is extremely boring b/c he drones on endlessly about relatively simple concepts. You can study as much as you want for the exams, but good luck... class average was around 57%.

Dr.Spalek is a great teacher, but in my opinion he doesn't hand out enough savoury snacks in class. Also, there should be more movies in class (Home alone 2?). In summary, Dr.Spalek is a brilliant individual with a blatant disregaurd for snack etiquit

Being in class isn't mandatory as he records his lectures but can be useful to see the video examples. His notes (which he doesn't provide, must take yourself) & the textbook (requires LOTS of reading) don't always overlap so both are important. The 3 thought questions were doable (worth 15%). MT (40%) & final (45%) were a bit tricky so don't cram!

I think he designed this course for his own convenience. e.g. : MC exams, No lecture slides, made 250+ students get up, line up at the front at the beginning of final exam to show ID before picking up the exam (instead of going around to check as we write exam). This was a waste of half an hour which prompted us to stay past our designated time

Enjoyed going to his lectures. Good lecturer, but the textbook was dreadful and long. He does not post any lecture slides online and expects us to take our own notes. Lectures are recorded and he recommended we go back and listen to lectures again (as if we have extra 3 hours to spare EVERY week). Would not recommend for non-majors.

AMAZING prof!! Very passionate and knowledgeable about cognitive psych, talks to students instead of lecturing them/reading off of slides...makes 3 hour lectures fly by. Gives tons of examples and midterms/final were all multiple choice. Fav prof at SFU so far!

Richard is very friendly, helpful -gives u advice for grad school, and extremely fair in his all MC exams. Ignore the person 2 posts under me, they r just mad at the ta's which shouldnt accumulate onto richard's grading. also as a side note: kiran and george were friendly and fair in their marking. i did my papers last min and got an A.

His class is really easy if you read the textbook and start studying early. ignore the person under me, they are just very mad about their mark and not thinking straight. george and karen were very easy/fair markers. did my paper last min and got an A on all them. Richard also very friendly, understanding, and extremely fair for his MC exams.

Terrible teaching! The percentage range is so bad it's not even funny. I passed everything and i still got a D! 50 - 59% = D.  Also very unlikable and unfriendly TA's Karen and George.especially Karen. Just remember, if these are the people you encounter. Passing will not even get you a C-. "Not fair markers". Be warned
goes off on funny tangents, made 9:30 class on Friday worth going to
